byline.contributor: John Mura contributed reporting from Morehead, Ky.

abstract: Jailing of Rowan County, Ky, clerk Kim Davis for refusing to issue marriage licenses to gay couples has stirred wave of resistance from religious conservatives, interrupting relative calm after Supreme Court decision; Republican presidential candidates, state legislators and grassroots activists all point to gathering storm of protest.
lead_paragraph: Kim Davis’s refusal to issue marriage licenses to gay couples will probably lead to legislation creating exemptions for workers like her, but it has also exposed divisions among Republicans.

headline.main: Uneasy Truce on Gay Marriage Is Shaken by Kentucky Clerk’s Defiance
headline.print_headline: Uneasy Truce on Gay Marriage Is Shaken by Kentucky Clerk’s Defiance

snippet: Kim Davis’s refusal to issue marriage licenses to gay couples will probably lead to legislation creating exemptions for workers like her, but it has also exposed divisions among Republicans.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
